p: Plants of the Ouratea genus contain several types of flavonoids, like flavones, flavonols, isoflavones, chalcones, and anthocianins in the form of monomers, glycosides, bi- or bisflavonoids, like hexaspermone, amentoflavone, agatisflavone, robustaflavone, and lanaraflavone. The biflavonoid 7′′-O-methylagatisflavone (from O. hexasperma), amentoflavone (from O. semiserrata), and the acetylated derivative of amentoflavone presented DNA inhibitory activity to poisomerase type I, and potent inhibition of the growth of Ehrlich carcinoma cells [ 5].
